result.execSummary:
The defendant Dominic L Collins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid by 10-15-2016. Defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay related surcharge by 10-15-2016. Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.  Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

with credit for 2 days served. TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.
Consecutive to: to any other sentence.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dominic L Collins

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dominic L Collins in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Paul Hauer for Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

 The Court ordered the Defendant to:
-Serve 2 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 2 days time served.  
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid by 10/15/2016; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay related surcharge by 10/15/2016; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Filed, Pretrial Incarceration Credit
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

THIS IS A TIME SERVED DISPOSITION
Branch 17 in jury trial.  Case spun to Branch 15.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services pretrial report dated 10/14/15 received and filed.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.

Defendant Dominic L Collins in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Danielle Chojnacki on behalf of Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin
.  Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.  
AS TO COUNT 1 :

The defendant was advised of his Constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

Parties advised the Court will listen to statements by counsel, the victim  and the defendant.   Any other statements must be in writing and provided to the Court 3 business days in advance of the sentencing. 

Case adjourned for sentencing hearing on 10-15-2015 at 8:30 am, branch 17.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report dated August 28, 2015 received and filed. tk

Defendant Dominic L Collins in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor. Paul Hauer on behalf of Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
For reasons placed on the record, Court orders case for adjourned projected Plea and Sentencing on 08-31-2015 at 08:30 am, Branch 17.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 31, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report dated August 12, 2015 received and filed. tk

Defendant Dominic L Collins in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Defendant Dominic L Collins in custody.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Case set for projected plea and sentencing. Proceeded to plea hearing. Case passed. Case recalled, in chambers discussion placed on the record. For reasons placed on the record case adjourned for plea and sentencing hearing on 08-13-2015 at 8:30 am, branch 17.   Parties notified that effective August 1, 2015, Branch 17 will be located in the Safety Building, room 310. Note:  Court REITERATES that the defendant MAINTAIN Absolute Sobriety and NOT possess or use any controlled substances unless by valid prescription.  No possession of any firearms or dangerous weapons.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor in court, defendant Dominic L Collins not in court, in custody, not produced.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Held off the record. Defense counsel has received discovery. Case for adjourned projected Plea and Sentencing, Branch 17.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dominic L Collins in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Defendant Dominic L Collins in custody.  Danielle Chojnacki for Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.   Court enters a not guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Notice of Motion and Motion to Reduce Bail

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Dominic L Collins in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Dominic L Collins in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
